description: Describes the tenant databases in a DB instance that uses the multi-tenant configuration. Only RDS for Oracle CDB instances are supported.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: A filter that specifies one or more database tenants to describe. Supported filters: tenant-db-name - Tenant database names. The results list only includes information about the tenant databases that match these tenant DB names. tenant-database-resource-id - Tenant database resource identifiers. dbi-resource-id - DB instance resource identifiers. The results list only includes information about the tenants contained within the DB instances identified by these resource identifiers. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as IDs. The filters supported by a describe operation are documented with the describe operation. The following actions can be filtered: DescribeDBClusterBacktracks DescribeDBClusterEndpoints DescribeDBClusters DescribeDBInstances DescribeDBRecommendations DescribeDBShardGroups DescribePendingMaintenanceActions The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous DescribeTenantDatabases request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

nested_items.name: TenantDatabases
nested_items.description: An array of the tenant databases requested by the DescribeTenantDatabases operation.

nested_items.name: TenantDatabaseCreateTime
nested_items.description: The creation time of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID of the DB instance that contains the tenant database.

nested_items.name: TenantDBName
nested_items.description: The database name of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The master username of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: DbiResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: TenantDatabaseResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the tenant database.

nested_items.name: TenantDatabaseARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the tenant database.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The character set of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: NcharCharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The NCHAR character set name of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtection
nested_items.description: Specifies whether deletion protection is enabled for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: Information about pending changes for a tenant database.

nested_items.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_items.description: The master password for the tenant database.

nested_items.name: TenantDBName
nested_items.description: The name of the tenant database.

nested_items.name: MasterUserSecret
nested_items.description: Contains the secret managed by RDS in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager for the master user password.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret.

nested_items.name: SecretStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the secret.
creating - The secret is being created.
active - The secret is available for normal use and rotation.
rotating - The secret is being rotated.

impaired - The secret can be used to access database credentials, but it can't be rotated. A secret might have this status if, for example, permissions are changed so that RDS can no longer access either the secret or the KMS key for the secret. When a secret has this status, you can correct the condition that caused the status. Alternatively, modify the DB instance to turn off automatic management of database credentials, and then modify the DB instance again to turn on automatic management of database credentials.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the secret.

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: A list of tags.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').
